intro: Rubus celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubus genus, which includes many species of shrubs and vines known for their edible berries. The plant features thorny stems and trifoliate leaves, typical of the Rubus family. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and the fruit is a small, dark-colored berry. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within the genus.
